metadata.title: CVE-2022-24052 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
MariaDB CONNECT Storage Engine Heap-based Buffer Overflow PrivilegeEscalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers toescalate privileges on affected installations of MariaDB. Authentication isrequired to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within theprocessing of SQL queries. The issue results from the lack of propervalidation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to afixed-length heap-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerabilityto escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of theservice account. Was ZDI-CAN-16190.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24052` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadb3 - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-backup - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-client - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-client-10.6 - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-client-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-common - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-plugin-rocksdb - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-plugin-s3 - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-server - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-server-10.6 - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-server-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-test - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
mariadb-test-data - 1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.6 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.6.7-2ubuntu1').
